summary: Completed testing of Default Resume dropdown fix in Auto-Apply Settings. All backend API tests passed (7/7). All frontend UI tests passed - dropdown shows all 6 resume options (Original, Master, and 4 title variants) with correct badges.
passed_tests: GET /api/resumes returns resume with master_resume and title_versions fields
Auto-apply run correctly parses _master suffix and finds base resume
Auto-apply run correctly parses _variant_N suffix and finds base resume
Frontend: Default Resume dropdown shows 6 options total
Frontend: Original resume shows 'Primary' and 'ATS: 78' badges
Frontend: Master resume shows 'Master' and 'Enhanced' badges
Frontend: All 4 title variants show 'Variant' badge (Python Developer, Python Engineer, Backend Developer, Data Engineer)
Frontend: Selecting a variant updates the dropdown display
Frontend: Save Settings persists the selected resume_id correctly
Frontend: 'Settings saved!' toast notification appears after save

dropdown_options.details: Dropdown shows 6 options: 1 Original (with Primary/ATS badges), 1 Master (with Master/Enhanced badges), 4 Variants (with Variant badge)

resume_id_parsing_master.details: Backend correctly parses resume_id_master suffix to extract base_resume_id and version_type='master'

resume_id_parsing_variant.details: Backend correctly parses resume_id_variant_N suffix to extract base_resume_id, version_type='variant', and variant_index

settings_persistence.details: Selected resume_id (including _master and _variant_N suffixes) persists correctly via POST /api/auto-apply/settings

critical_code_review_comments: Frontend flatMap correctly generates SelectItems for Original, Master, and all title_versions
Backend auto-apply run function at line 4837-4847 correctly parses _master and _variant_N suffixes
Backend process_auto_apply_for_user function at line 6393-6403 has identical parsing logic for scheduled runs
Each option type has distinct badge styling (Primary=blue, Master=violet, Variant=amber)
seed_data_creation: None - used existing test user with resume_id='resume_8c4696bc3a38' that has master_resume and 4 title_versions
context_for_next_testing_agent: Default Resume dropdown fix verified. The dropdown in Auto-Apply Settings now shows all resume versions: Original (with Primary/ATS badges), Master (with Master/Enhanced badges), and all title variants (with Variant badge). Backend correctly parses resume_id suffixes (_master, _variant_N) in both run_auto_apply and process_auto_apply_for_user functions.
